definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: "There's always a lot of confusion, but we're used to it, " says Livia Savarese, 23, a Naples psychology student and part-time social-services worker.
sentences.chinese: 这里一直有许多的混乱，但是我们已经习以为常。

sentences.english: Any third-party vendor so used has agreed to protect the confidentiality of information provided by VCES.
sentences.chinese: 任何第三方卖主习以为常答应保密资料器件。

sentences.english: People are unware of the common mistakes once they are too accustomed to them.
sentences.chinese: 习以为常容易使人忽视一些常见错误。

sentences.english: The Chinese are very used to the idea of mistresses, and what one must do to keep them happy.
sentences.chinese: 中国富豪对情人习以为常，并且没有会让他们不开心。

sentences.english: But Beijingers are used to epic-scale gridlock.
sentences.chinese: 但是北京人对这种规模巨大的交通阻塞早已习以为常。

sentences.english: By contrast, the British media has regularly covered the return of coffins.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，英国媒体对运回棺木的报道已经习以为常。

sentences.english: But Xie was used to this kind of discouragement.
sentences.chinese: 但是解海龙对这样的劝阻已经习以为常。

sentences.english: They take care of chat, that I am a reticent person, accustomed to.
sentences.chinese: 她们自顾闲谈，以为我是一个寡言的人，习以为常。

sentences.english: Or perhaps the islanders grew so used to the work that they just couldn't stop themselves.
sentences.chinese: 或者，岛民对修建工作习以为常，无法停止下来。

sentences.english: I’ve actually come to like the sting.
sentences.chinese: 我实际上就习以为常了，就当是蚊虫叮一下了。

sentences.english: It calls for the re-examination and criticism of a good many matters which seemed comfortably settled, and which we would rather leave undisturbed.
sentences.chinese: 其二它需要我们重新审视和批判大量习以为常的东西。

sentences.english: For a long time, Neigh Korea has been accustomed to economic difficulty and international isolation.
sentences.chinese: 对于长期的经济困难与国际孤立，朝鲜早已习以为常。

sentences.english: We have taken antibiotics and other antimicrobials for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经对各种抗生素和其他抗菌药习以为常。

sentences.english: After that the special missions became frequent Occurances.
sentences.chinese: 从此以后，特殊任务就司空见惯，习以为常了。

sentences.english: He took his wonted place in the reading room.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在阅览室他习以为常的位置。

definition: to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to pay no attention to/not to mind
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
